content_suggestions.issue: No dedicated Summary section tailored to the target role.
content_suggestions.recommended_change: Add a concise 2–4 sentence Summary at the top that foregrounds computer vision, production-grade CV systems, and cross-functional leadership in manufacturing/industrial contexts; include job-relevant keywords.

example_before_after.after: Summary: Results-driven Computer Vision Engineer with hands-on experience building and deploying CV systems for industrial and aerospace applications. Proficient in Python, PyTorch, OpenCV, and edge computing, delivering end-to-end production pipelines and real-time dashboards. Led cross-functional teams to implement multi-object detection/tracking and IoT integration in mission-critical projects.

content_suggestions.issue: Non-standard/merged section names and overly granular sub-sections may hinder ATS parsing.
content_suggestions.recommended_change: Standardize headers to ATS-friendly names: 'Summary', 'Work Experience' (instead of 'Work Experience' is fine; ensure it’s clearly labeled), 'Skills' (combine Technical/Soft into two clearly labeled blocks), 'Certifications', 'Projects', 'Education', 'Languages'. Move 'Academic Publications' and 'Personal Projects' into appropriate standard sections or create a separate 'Publications' or 'Projects' section as needed.

formatting_suggestions.recommended_change: Aim for a clean, ATS-friendly one-page (or at most two pages for senior profiles). Use a consistent font, spacing, and bullet style. Avoid tables, text boxes, icons, or images.
Use concise bullets starting with strong action verbs; limit to 2–5 bullets per role; ensure consistent punctuation and tense (past for past roles).
Place Summary at the top, followed by Work Experience, Skills, Projects, Certifications, Education, Languages; consider moving Publications to a separate section if retained.
Adopt a results-focused tone: 'Led', 'Delivered', 'Launched', 'Implemented'; avoid phrases like 'responsible for' and ensure consistent past tense for prior roles.
Ensure keywords appear naturally in bullet text; avoid non-standard formatting; test with a keyword-based ATS parser to confirm capture.
